Title: Tune That Battle Axe! 25/? Author: Generation: Gewone G1 Characters: Bumblebee, Spike, Tracks, Ratchet, Cliffjumper, Inferno, Red Alert Rating: Teen Warning(s): Nothing this time. Summary: Meanwhile back at the Ark, the others finally find out whom might have been responsible for messing with Gamma's repairs. Disclaimer: Don't own Transformers. Thats why reality is the way it is... A/N: Sorry for the delay, RL is a pain in the differential at times, that and procrastination. Especially procrastination.
===^v^v^===
When Bumblebee and Spike returned to the Ark, the near emptiness of the base was a stark contrast to what they left. Instead of bustling activity, they only found Tracks, Cliffjumper, Ratchet, and the recently returned to base Inferno and Red Alert. Their attention was on whatever was on Teletraan's main screen. By their individual reactions, it wasn't from a soap opera. "Impossible!" "Only in this planet's myth and legend do they get that big!" "It wasn't a malfunction after all, but sabotage!" "Primus! We'll have to make upgrades to the security system, if something like that got in. Oh great, oh slagging great!" "Relax Red! Who'd knew *that* would get in, at least it wasn't a Decepticon!" "Still Inferno, what if one of the Decepticons find a simular way? What if it was Skywarp?!" "Skywarp isn't even smart enough to mess with those controls." After letting Spike out of his passenger compartment to transform out of alt mode, Bumblebee was the first to get the attention of somebody of those assembled. "So, whats so interesting guys: 'As the Kitchen Sinks' on?" He joked. Ratchet looked away from Teletraan's screen to address the recent arrival, urgent to get an answer that the mini-bot might have. "Nothing as mundane but amusing as that, Bumblebee. Do you remember that brown Autobot that was brought in before you left on patrol?" "The shot-up one? The one who "got the drop" on Wheeljack outside soon after?" "Yes, the same. Did you see anything out of the ordinary while waiting for Spike in my Med bay?" "Nothing, just as things usually are around here. That is until Gamma... is that his name?" "Yes it is 'Bee, continue." "Until Gamma came out of that automated repair thing you and 'Jack made. Didn't look the same like as he went in." "Then I'd think you better see this. Spike, you might want to watch as well, to get a human perspective." As Spike Witwicky and his Cybertronian buddy joined closer to those who stayed behind in the Ark, Ratchet continued. "It has been discovered that there wasn't a malfunction as first feared in why Gamma Antares managed to look like a Cabrabot now..." "A 'Cabrabot' Ratchet?" A puzzled Bumblebee asked. "A term those of us here came up with while the both of you were out on patrol. Not even Prime and the others know about this yet." Spike was curious as to why the base had relatively sparce personnel at the Ark upon his and 'Bee's return. "Where are they now, guys?" "En route to someplace in Southern California called 'Calico'. It was found out that the Decepticons are using that tourist destination in the desert as a Space Bridge location. Prime is letting Gamma return to Cybertron to retrieve some valuable data contained in an axe Gamma left behind." The last part about 'data in an axe' left Spike a bit confused until Tracks jumped in to explain. "Spike, you've been with us long enough to know that not everything is at it seems at first." Spike looked around at those who were in the main control room with him, and remembered that yes, his mechanical buddies worked at a much different paradigm than he was used to: on Earth an axe was just an axe to chop a tree down, not something that can also be used to store Grandma Vivian's chocolate chip cookie recipe as well. It wasn't that he took his Cybertronian buddies for granted, maybe he did to a point, but there is much more he doesn't know about the technologies about his friends that he would need more lifetimes to learn about. Tracks continued, "Gamma claims that his interface contains sensitive data about where he was staying at, a planet called "K'Veht" if I remember correctly, that he doesn't want in Decepticon hands. He, Jazz, and Wheeljack are returning to Cybertron to recover it." When the Autobot scout and his human friend came within view of Teletraan's mainscreen, Tracks then started with his demonstration. "As one can see in this raw security stream, Gamma is seen being brought into the automated repair construct by Ratchet and Ironhide. After setting up the chamber Gamma was in, Ratchet then left to attend to Mirage's maintenence while automated repair took care of our recent arrival. Things appeared to go well during the entire process for the time it took for the repairs to be made, but when Gamma was finished and emerged from the chamber, obviously for those who've known him for a while, noticed right off that the same Gamma Antares wasn't the same afterwards: something went wrong in repairs that somehow didn't alert Ratchet's attention." "That's right," The Autobot CMO chimed in. "I suspected that nothing went wrong until Gamm was done, but I couldn't stop him in time from reporting to Optimus, as the repair apparatus somehow signaled Prime that Gamma was ready for duty." Turning to Bumblebee, the CMO asked the scout for his side of the story. "Did you see anything unusual, 'Bee?" "Not a thing, Ratchet. Just as you said: Nothing strange... until Gamma came out that is." "Hmm..." Thoughtful, Tracks then went into the next part. "When I went through the entire feed, at first I saw nothing was wrong, until I did a close-up analysis of the chamber's controls." Starting the playback of the close-up footage, Tracks was careful to point out a detail to everyone assembled. "As one can see from the angle the sensors were able to supply, the controls of the chamber started to self-motivate themselves, and from Ratchet's testimony, something that they were not designed to do!" Ratchet nodded in agreement as Tracks continued with with his findings. "After extensive filtering with the help of Red Alert, we found that a cloaking technology of an advanced level, even by Cybertronian standards, were used to hide who or what was behind Gamma's new face plate and helm features." "More like who..." Red Alert interrupted, only to be quieted down by Inferno. Letting the slight interruption go, Tracks continued. He switched Tele-traan's main viewer to the security footage he needed to show. "After going through the known spectra that energy could be picked-up from the security system and finding nothing, Red Alert suggested sweeping through all possible and theoretical spectra to find that our mysterious guest was using a phased patchwork of energies to mask his presence. Almost like he is existing on more than one dimensional plane at the same time." "Will Wheeljack get a copy of this with your theory?" Ratchet inquired. "This kind of thing is exactly his department!" Tracks nodded. "This will keep him busy just thinking about the possibilities for vorns." Redirecting attention to the screen, he continued with his findings. "Anyway as one can see, after Gamma was placed in the chamber and Ratchet activated the mechanism, the CMO left to attend to other duties. Mili-kliks later another entitiy appeared, roughly the stature of Red here..." "Why are you picking me out?!" The ever-paranoid Red Alert blurted out. "Stick it in neutral, will ya?" Ordered a slightly irritated Ratchet. "He's only picking you out for size reference!" "Oh." Giving a bit of sly optic to the head of security, Tracks continued on. "...And then appeared to extend some kind of data coupling from inside his dark, hooded cloak and plugged it into the console. Subject then started doing what originally gave his presence away: manipulating the controls of the repair chamber." This gave way to sounds of various "Huhs" and contemplative sounds from those assembled in the main control room. "Then, checking to see if anybody was watching," Tracks not missing a beat, "then briefly turned to reveal what he actually looked like." Those who had not seen the footage before were aghast at the sight: they saw a humanoid face from within the hood looking towards Ratchet's repair bay to see if anybody noticed. Finding nobody knew of his presence, the figure gave a slight shrug and went back to what he was doing. Puzzled, Bumblebee asked, "What's with the data cable?" "Records that we did get showed that some of Gamma's files were backed-up," Ratchet not missing a beat in reply. He further analyzed what data from the automated repair chamber he could find while Tracks filtered the security footage. "I found new specifications for Gamma were uploaded at the same time, overwriting some of his original specs as a result. I have no idea if anything else was overwritten at the time." "So his personality could have been modified without his knowing?" Cliffjumper inquired. "Perhaps." "I'll add him to my list... just in case!" This caused a chorus of groans, guffaws, and at least an "Oh man!" from the others. Perturbed, Ratchet demanded Cliffjumper to not do it: putting the Prime's old friend was rather pushing it. If Optimus found out, the Prime would be livid to the point of wanting to know everybody else who was on it. And why! "Just a precaution!" "No!" The Autobot CMO demanded. "Alright Ratchet." The minibot resigned. Without giving intention emotionally, Cliffjumper quietly added the Cabrabot to his mental list anyway.

Title: Robots of Futures Past - 2/3 Chapter: Shockwave's Bender (Little Silver Robots) Author: Generation: G1-ish/Futurama!verse (sometime before the four DVD-movies.) Characters: Shockwave, Task'r(oc), Knightstick(oc)*, Starscream and Hook (briefly), Futurama cast Rating: T Warning(s): Drunk & emo-ish Shockwave, Bender being himself. Summary: Shockwave has an unexpected visitor during his down time. Disclaimer: HasTak owns "Transformers", we all know who owns "Futurama": I'm just doing this little mash-up for the jollys, no money. A/N: These plot bunnies have been taking up space for so long, but instead of putting them up for adoption on where they'd grow old and die unloved,as all of the other ones I posted I decided to write these myself. These pairings are of any!verse TF, and that of a robot (or computer) of SF past. All of these are very AU, so take as one will. * I'm willing to put Knightstick up for adoption on if someone thinks he deserves further development. Inquire within!
===^v^v^===

The little holographic mech was taunting the over-energized custodian of Decepticon rule of Cybertron. The more Shockwave tried to ignore the irritating pest, the more emboldened the image got into being a pain in the gear. Shockwave didn't want the fact known to his own minions that he regularly got slag-faced on mixing small amounts of Ultra grade energon that he hid from everybody else due to the difficulty of its acquisition, with his ration of High grade. He imbibed in private to deal with the mounting tension of taking care of Cybertron he faced with every rotation: with the continual raids of the Autobot Underground taking what little Cybertron received from Megatron, to the discipline problems within ranks, Shockwave faced a myriad of problems. Now this. Shockwave heard of the legend of the humans of Earth who hallucinated something called "little pink elephants" when they over-energized, but he just filed it away under the heading of "Why being organic is inferior", and gave it no mind until the moment this glitchy pest all of a sudden appeared on his desk. "Little fragging glitch!" "Listen pal, just because I show up unannounced while you were tying one on doesn't mean you don't want to have a drinking buddy. I even brought my own!" While he was saying that, Bender opened the compartment in his torso to retrieve a bottle of malt liquor to show the much larger robot that he wasn't lying. At least this time. "So, what are you drinkin'? Looks like pink lemonade." Bender then proceeded to drink 1/4 of the Olde Fortran 40 ounce. The oscilloscope display that indicated when the tiny mech spoke went offline long enough for him to open it to access his fueling port. "It is definitely NOT pink lemonade, fool! It is energon." Out of frustration, Shockwave retorted angrily. "And nothing like that stuff you're drinking, looks like something squeezed out of a human's waste sub-system!" "Its the finest of malt liquor, like you would know. Besides, what would you know about those pathetic meatbags?" Bender harrumphed,"One of my best friends happens to be human!" Raising his left arm, Shockwave became incredulous at such a statement. "Friend of a human?! Must mean you're an Autobot, or at least a sympathizer!" Shockwave aimed his weapon at the little target, and fired a bolt. The blast went through Bender harmlessly to blast a large chunk out of the Decepticon's desk. "Slaggit!" "Ha, didn't anybody tell you: you can't shoot a hologram?" Bender then deployed a cigar, while storing the 3/4 that remained of the bottle of his beverage. After putting the cigar in his vocal display, Bender continued while lighting up, "Are you guys manufactured stupid around here, or what?" "How dare you insult my intelligence like that, glitch! I'm in charge of a whole planet of mechanized life forms..." "Why didn't you tell me I'm making a visit to Robot Planet?" Bender exclaimed enthusiastically I have some chums here, well o.k., maybe a few." "This is not "Robot Planet"!" If Shockwave could spit, the term of "robot" would have left his vocalizer with such venom at the term, he considered it that much of an insult. "You are on the planet Cybertron, fool! I'm of a mechanized lifeforms millions of Earth years in existence..." "Hey, I'm from Earth..." "Impossible! Humans don't have the technology or intelligence to manufacture advanced mechanisms." Shockwave reached for a button on the remains of his desk to call security. It flashed that it was working, but the large blue-violet mech wasn't entirely sure, since he had just blasted part of his desk away because of this little silver pest. Bender retorted, "Where and when I'm from, you have been proven so wrong, pal!" "What?!" "That's right. Meatbags and us robots live on Earth, even as I speak." "Impossible!" "Sounds like you have a real problem with it, you sayin' "Impossible" all the time..." "Can't be. My leader Megatron..." "Who?" Shockwave didn't get a chance to answer, as a couple of security-grade Decepticons entered the office, distracting Soudwave. The distraction gave opportunity for Bender to activate a control that was on his right wrist. Before the experiment, Farnsworth had the robot put on the remote unit as a precaution. All it did was adjust the robot's visibility to his surroundings that he was in, as well as give a recall signal back to Planet Express headquarters for when Bender got bored with the experiment, or something serious happened. Bender decided at that moment to go stealth to observe what was happening. The small robot hoped that he wasn't seen when the two additional mechanisms entered the area. "What is the emergency Shockwave?" The burgundy and black mech asked, weapon at ready. "Knightstick and I were the closest when you sounded the alarm." "Do you see it Task'r?" Shockwave ordered the guards' attention to his desk. "There was a small silver construct on my desk here a klik ago..." "I see nothing there but some empty cubes, Shockwave." The other security mech, Knightstick answered back. Both security mechs had heard rumors of what Shockwave did in private: Task'r-Seven, who didn't like his superior at all, took such as true until proven otherwise. Knightstick had his doubts about the whole thing, but this call started a microkernal of suspicion in the red and blue mech's mind. "Those are none of your concern!" Shockwave retorted angrily, "We have a security breach here, and that Autobot sympathizer must be here somewhere." When Shockwave turned to inspect a stack of data pads on his desk, Task'r mimicked a motion to his cohort of throwing back a drink with his left hand, making Knightstick chuckle a small bit, accidentally distracting Shockwave from his search. "What's so slagging funny?!" Shockwave was angrier this time when he turned to face the two mechs. "You two nickel-plated knuckle heads start searching my office!" Shockwave turned to search the remains of his desk further. While in stealth mode, Bender tried his best to contain his amusement. Seeing the interchange between the two other mechs only confirmed to the relatively tiny robot that his unannounced appearance to the larger blue-violet machine was more than random chance, but an opportunity to take advantage of the situation while he can. While coming up with the most diabolical plan his CPU can muster, he observed the action around him. The three gigantic mechs looked everywhere: inside consoles, behind fixtures, even behind what spare furnishings Shockwave had in his office: all places where a small construct could even fit into, but all clear of infiltration. An idea came to Bender: he heard that the humans used a talent called "ventriloquism" for entertainment purposes, so after researching what little knowledge he had stored on the subject, he decided to try his hand with it. The robot from the 31st century turned to the bulkhead furthest from the three Cybertronians, and shouted "Hey you deuterium dum-dums, I'm over here!" This produced the desired effect, as Bender actually made it sound like he was near the wall, causing the three giant mechs to continue their search over at the very wall the voice came from. Emboldened with his new-found talent, Bender then decided to try the wall that was behind Shockwave's desk. He noticed that there was an inset depression in the wall, possibly indicating a storage compartment of some kind: this would be perfect! He then projected his vocalizer energy in that direction. "Hey! I'm in the wall behind the desk!" "No! Not there!" Was the only possible way Shockwave can show panic in his otherwise featureless helm, his sole optic nearly went pale at the thought of his minions finding out what was behind that panel, and mostly on how the infiltrator managed to get inside. In a serious mood, Task'r-Seven wanted to know what Shockwave was in a panic about. His motion to get at the panel was stopped-short by his superior. "I can't allow you to look there Task'r." Ordered the blue-violet mech. "Why not? As security, we have authority to search any probable place where any and all hostile elements may hide." Knightstick answered plainly. As head of security while Cybertron is under Decepticon rule, the red and blue mech knew all procedures that pertained to his duties. It was a job he didn't take lightly, and he didn't want to see one of his own underlings being prevented from fulfilling duty in same fashion. Task'r's optics burned deep red of rage at Shockwave: he still didn't like the punitive measures that were levied against him for the debacle over an Autobot multi-face he was put guard on at a prior time: being cut not only in energon ration, but rank as well still didn't sit well with the burgundy and black mech for being made a scapegoat over the whole thing. Now this. The only plus to all that was being put under Knightstick's authority. The low-speed hover made a good ally of the large ground-based mech. "Alright, alright!" Shockwave capitulated, "Only as long as I'm the one to open the panel." "Agreed." The two security mechs said in near-unison. Shockwave carefully positioned himself in front of the panel, backplates being the only thing that the two security mechs saw while he punched the security code. When the panel opened, Shockwave hurriedly tried to hide some stuff out of view, but Knightstick was quick to intervene. "What are you trying to hide there, sir?" Knightstick demanded; he wasn't about to have anyone, even Shockwave, try to hide anything from him. "We have to take a look regardless of what you might have in there." "Alright then," standing up to let Knightstick have a look, Shockwave suddenly had a urge to steady himself by bracing against his desk. Not knowing if it was panic on what will be found, or quickly standing up made him a bit disoriented in his gyros in his over-energized condition. "Just don't mess things in there too much." Without a word, Knightstick deployed an illumination device from his right wrist assembly and crouched down to take a better look at the contents. The first find was something the head of security never expected: a stack of hardcopy. Picking an issue up, Knightstick examined it. "What the... "PlayMech" Magazine?" Came the red and blue mech's reaction. He never had heard of such a thing before, and the document quickly became a curiosity to both he and his underling, as Task'r was looking over Knightstick's shoulder assembly to see what the fuss was all about. As Knightstick went to a pictorial layout, one could hear a pin drop as both mechs saw a seductive pose of a gold and lavender femme lying on her venial plates: her legs were bent up at the knees, with her lower legs in a "V" position, while she held a wrench gently and seductively in her hands. Acting quickly, Shockwave took the hardcopy out of his security head's hands and placed it on his desk, not realizing that Bender was still invisible. When Bender saw the picture, he was beside himself: of all the femmes he ever saw, none even looked as well put-together as the one in the photo he saw at the moment. He made a note to ask Farnsworth if there will be tactile upgrades for the system for a future visit, that is if he ever makes it back. He was about to check his chronometer, when activity distracted him. "What is this slag? Playing with dolls for a mech your age?" It was Task'r who sarcastically asked. He was better attuned to what what such things were, as his curiosity drove him to learn about Earth when time permitted; he even found that he liked the sport of Rugby as a result, but for pure Decepticon reasons, if anything. "No!" Shockwave retorted angrily, "I'm conducting a science experiment." "Right, with Optimus Prime and Starscream dolls. Sure!" Task'r's cynicism was thick. "I'm seeing if Voodoo really works." Snatching the crudely made fabric Starscream doll out of Knightstick's hand, Shockwave was quick to add. "Human superstition, that's all." Task'r was defiant, "Prove it works, then I'll believe!" "Alright, Mr. Smart-Aft." Shockwave was equally defiant. He placed the doll on his desk, took one of the pins and plunged it into the doll's midsection...

***
In the Nemesis, Starscream was in his lab with Hook, when a stabbing sensation in his own midsection caused him to double-over in pain. "Hook!" The Decepticon Air Commander called to his cohort, falling to his knees, "There's that pain again!" "Last time it happened, I couldn't find anything wrong!" The Constructicon said when coming to Starscream's aid...
***
"Well?" Demanded Task'r. "I guess I'll never know for sure." Was Shockwave's only answer. "Figures!" With arms crossed over chestplates, Task'r was displeased with the alleged lack of results. He beamed angrily at Shockwave. "I guess we'll never know who or what was here then," Knightstick resigned while getting up, "Task, I think we'd better go." "Sure," The younger mech answered back. "Probably just glitch mice, that's all." "I'll request a deep sweep of the facilities, if you like Shockwave." Kinghtstick offered, "Just to make sure there isn't a major security breach somewhere." "When?" "In perhaps an orn or so, at best." "Not any sooner?" Shockwave didn't like the answer he got from the security head. "The situation calls for one now." "With the thinned-out forces we have: some on Earth and elsewhere doing whatever, its the best that can be done on short notice." Not believing at first that things have gotten to this point, Shockwave had to face the fact that he'd had to wait for a basic sweep of his office. Circulating air through his vents, he figured the crisis was over: the invader was truly gone. "Alright, so be it then. You two are dismissed." Both security mechs snapped to attention to give their superior a salute, and left the office leaving Shockwave alone. Sitting back at his desk, Shockwave decided he needed another shot of Ultra, so he opened a drawer to his right to get to his secret stash. Dispensing a cube, he brought it up to his helm to consume. "You can't get rid of me that easily!" said the unseen voice, startling the unsuspecting Decepticon. Shaken, Shockwave accidentally dropped the cube; energon getting all over his thigh armor and the deck plating under pede. "GAH! I thought you left me alone!" The Decepticon was exasperated at the thought of having to deal with the tiny mech again. With his sole optic, he observed the uninvited guest slowly fade back to visibility. "And what, miss all that fun?" The small bot replied after re-establishing full visibility, "You must have a CPU loose!" "YOU CALL ALL THAT, FUN?!" The Decepticon was furious, "You made me look like a fool in front of my minions." "And I made it look easy too!" Bender quickly added, while doing a mock-polishing of his finger tips in self-satisfaction. At his wits end with this unwanted visitor, Shockwave tried to make a grab at the smaller mech, only to find that his right hand went through Bender, causing the hologram to shimmy a bit that didn't go unnoticed by the image. "Wow, that's cool. I think I'll have you try that again!" "No! Just leave me alone!" "And if I don't?" Bender challenged defiantly. "GAH!" In a fit of rage, Shockwave with a sweep of his left arm cleared the debris from his desk: magazine, empty cubes, and data pads in all. He then rested his faceplates in hand and weapon emitter, and cycled some air through his vents. "I give up. Just please leave me." "Alright then," Bender hit the recall control on his remote. As he faded from view, the form of the small mech warned Shockwave, "You haven't seen the last of Bender Bending Rodriguez!" "I was afraid of that..." were the last words Bender heard before the all became blackness.

***
At the Planet Express HQ in New New York, all personnel were on virtual pins and needles while awaiting Bender's return. None was most nervous about it all than Bender's best friend: Philip J. Frye. The human was pacing back and forth in front of Farnsworth's latest device, the Omni-Trans-Reality Portal. He was three-quarters distracted when the professor described the machine by stating that it worked on a variation of the Einstien-Rosen principle, whatever that was, and Bender was coaxed into being a robotic Guinea Pig in trying it out for the first time. If it really worked as Farnsworth theorized, safe travel to other times, places, and dimensions would be a boon to historians, scientists, opportunists, and the generally curious. Frye felt that something was wrong, and he can't for once be of little to no help for a change: Bender was gone for over two hours. "Will you stop pacing like that Frye?" Leela, the cycloptic pilot of Planet Express' only ship, said in an exasperated tone, she had to literally put her arm out to stop Frye from his continued pace. "I'm starting to develop a cramp in my eye just watching you, and besides, you've practically worn a way into Old New York by now!" "Sorry Leela," Frye said in a tone that was impatient edging on the despondent. "Bender's been in there for a while. We don't know if he's alright." "I'm quite sure he's alright," remarked Professor Farnsworth from a nearby table. He, Dr. Zoidberg, Amy Wong, and Conrad Hermes were playing Plutonian Poker while waiting for Bender's return: due to the nature of the Plutonian playing cards, everyone had to wear protective gloves as the cards were made of slowly vaporizing dry ice. "I personally made sure he was wearing the remote before he went in." "Still, too bad you didn't install a way to see him in there. Or at least hear him." Frye was displeased with the answer. In another half-hour he would need Bender around when "Everybody Loves HypnoToad" was aired, just in case the delivery boy went catatonic during the show; one time the robot managed to snap Frye out of it just in time for a bathroom break. "Maybe on a later model, this is just a prototype: I don't want the surroundings to come in contact with the fields the OTR produces. The effects could be catastrophic." The professor added. He turned to continue the game. "I see your ten quates and raise it to twenty, Zoidberg!." The red crustacean was beside himself: the professor figured he was bluffing. "GAH! I fold." Zoidberg then snapped his hand in half width-wise, much to the dismay of the others. "Zoidberg!" Hermes spoke up, "Only the winner can break his hand, not the loser!" "Sorry." Ashamed, the crustacean then got up to go to his office until everybody was alerted to the alarm on the OTR portal. "Great, Bender has used the recall on the remote!" An enthusiastic Farnsworth proclaimed, "I wonder where and when he went to: maybe somewhere everybody exists in the third dimension." "Oooh, deep man!" Said a voice in Nibbler's general direction. Everyone turned to see that Leela's pet was wearing a beret, sunglasses and playing a set of bongos. Dumbfounded, Leela and Frye just shrugged at each other; they didn't know that the little dark matter factory can speak when he wanted. Leela then looked at one of her hands and pondered aloud: "Maybe everyone has an extra finger?" "EWWWWW!" Was the only reaction she got from everyone, en mass. "Never mind all that," the professor told all assembled, "I certain he'll have plenty to talk about once he emerges. I'm starting retrieve and power-down right now!" Farnsworth then punched in a sequence that will insure the safe return of the test subject: it had to be done in proper order so that Bender won't somehow disappear due to some error, never to be seen or heard of again. When this was done and powered-down, the entrance then revealed a fully functional robot. Bender emerged from the holographic projection chamber of Farnsworth's latest invention, the robot was ecstatic. "Farnsworth!" The mech couldn't contain his glee for a moment, "Save those settings on that trans-time-dimension thingomajig you made!" Bender then produced another cigar and lit it, taking in one huge drag, and said while exhausting it. "Thanks to you, I now have a drinkin' buddy. A real big and miserable one at that!"

[Memory File:PDA00015:Accessed:Begin Playback...] "EPSILON!" Gamma hurriedly leapt off the stage into the audience section, landing a couple yards from where his spark brother lay, "Who did this?" "Gahm...help..." "Take it easy Epi, I'm here." Gamma approached his prone brother, with Jazz coming from the stage via a stairwell from stage left. When optics of both mechs adjusted to the lighting in the audience section, they were held aghast at Epsilon's condition: they noticed that Gamma's twin was in a sizeable pool of mech fluid, and that Epsilon's right arm was mostly severed. Crouching down, Gamma noticed that wasn't the only damage the other brown mech had sustained. There were multiple impact points that were inflicted his sides and intact left arm, as well as his helm; these wounds alone seemed to not be of a kind where instant deactivation would occur, they seemed of a kind where a blunt object was used instead, as there were dents and broken faceplates. After the initial visual shock, Jazz was the first to speak. "We better carefully get him on his backplates." Concerned, Gamma didn't like the idea. "You sure thats wise?" "I have some, eh, first aid knowledge. I can shunt some of the critical systems so getting him medical attention in a more stable state..." Jazz tried hard to hide the fact that he was going to actually to try to copy the data he thought Epsilon had in its entirety while doing first aid, without knowing that it was Gamma, actually his instrument interface, that held the bulk of the data. The original assignment from the Council was to meet up with the older Antares brother to escort Epsilon to the Prime personally to transfer the info of the burgeoning Decepticon rebellion: personnel, plans, battle tactics, everything Epsilon managed to gather while infiltrating the enclave. All this was threatened to be lost if Epsilon off-lined permanently. He had managed to convince Gamma to this point that he was just there to enjoy the show, without letting on that he knew Epsilon all this time. "... will be possible," Jazz continued, while reaching under the damaged mech's left side. "I can use a hand here." Reluctantly, the damaged mech's twin silently assisted in turning around his brother, changing position to the other side to gently place his fallen sibling on his back. When Gamma glanced at Epsilon's true extent of damage, a horrified look washed over his face plates. The entire front of the mech looked like it took the brunt of the impacts, badly dented and ripped armor plates exposed wiring and energon pathways that were still leaking what little was left. Epsilon's helm also showed its share of severe damage: the mech's right optic was smashed out, the top of his helm was broken away, leaving partially exposed his processing cluster. "Stand aside Gamma." Jazz was quick to act, starting to work on the damaged mech, doing the best as he can. When Jazz was about to connect a transfer cable between him and the Epsilon, the damaged mech managed to stop him with his left arm. "Nuh-nun-oh, Juh-hazz!" "My brother knows you?!" A shocked Gamma jumped in. "Gamma, please!" Turning back to Epsilon, Jazz spoke to the injured mech."You know why I'm here, agent!" "Duh-huh-hont hav-have t-t-t-t-it any muh-muh-muh-or-or-ore!" the dying mech was barely getting any words out of his vocalizer, critical pathways tried to re-route around the damage with little, if any success. Frantic about the news, Jazz was gently prodding for information."Your attackers have it?" The fatally wounded mech tried to shake his helm, but couldn't twist it to the right all the way, "N-n-unh No! Ga-gahm?" "Epi, my brother, I'm here." The intact twin gently approached his damaged brother. Gamma kneeled down on his left knee assembly. "Do you need some of my parts to stay functional? I'll do it in a spark pulse without asking..." "P-pl-plaeee yourrrrr-r-r-r ins-struh..." "S-sure Epi!" Gamma deployed his instrument within milliseconds, "What do you want to hear?" "Ani-nee-thuh.." With his left arm, Epsilon reached for the instrument, and without Gamma looking, attached a data transfer cable to the instrument. This didn't go unnoticed by Jazz, who was quickly surmising about who, or what, actually had the data he was ordered to retrieve. "Don't strain yourself, sure." Gamma gently spoke as he started to play something gentle and relaxing on his instrument. The melody and harmonies Gamma played soared with ethereal grace: ring modulated harmonics rising and intertwining with a deep pedal tone that was warm as a rising stellar mass after a cold night, but there was also a sadness in the piece that mourned a past that can't be re-lived: a new day never lets the past return, but in memories do they remain. Moments later Gamma finished playing his instrument, he was satisfied with how he played it this time: he was executing the trills and partial chords in time with hardly an unintended accidental to be heard. When he was about to put his instrument in storage mode, he noticed the data cable coming out of it, leading to his mortally wounded twin. Quickly snapping out of his musician's trance, Gamma gently asked, "Epi, why the cable?" "F-file encrypt..." was the only thing Epsilon could say before the extent of his damages caught up to him, causing his systems to crash permanently. With dimming optics and relaxing servos, the older Antares brother entered the Well of Allsparks, leaving a shell that was quickly changing from its deep brown color to a dull gray. Jazz quickly leaned over the fallen mech to confirm on his condition, gently unplugging the cable from Gamma's instrument in the process. "He's gone, Gamma. Nothing more I can do." He said gently. "Sorry for your loss." Wordlessly, Gamma stood up and gently placed his instrument on his back. The full weight of what had just happened was just starting to have an impact on the survivor's mind. Without knowing even if the newest member even survived, seeing his friends dead and witnessing the painful offlining of his brother was more than he could take, to the point of wanting to escape the carnage he was surrounded by. "Whoever did this will more than likely come after you as well." Jazz correctly spoke as he was standing up himself, looking around to make sure that nobody else was around. The possibility of somebody waiting for a chance to attack his new friend was too great, knowing now who had the data he was sent to retrieve. "I know of some folk who will protect you Gamma, a real great bunch of mechs..." "No!" "What Gamma?" "I'm not going. I want to be alone!" Gamma shot back, the full impact of what happened finally slamming his mind hard with horror, fear, and mostly, remorse of losing those who he was close to. The feelings were hitting him simultaneously from seemingly all directions, to the point that Gamma needed to be alone somewhere to sort through it all. "You can't be serious, what if whoever did this comes for you next?" Jazz wasn't expecting the reaction he was getting from his companion: he'd figured after all that had happened, Gamma would be reasonable about his suggestion about seeking a location of safety protected by the others. Jazz correctly reasoned that Gamma had actually been the one who he was to meet, and not Epsilon as originally thought, and throughout the journey to Musidrome; from getting off a bombed-out overpass, through underground passages to find a ripped out backstage entrance to the carnage found in the main auditorium, not realizing that his assignment was mere micro vuns away. "Be reasonable for a moment!" Jazz did his best to contain his frustration. "Who will protect you then?" "I'll take my chances." "Have you stripped a helm cog Gamma? You are in grave danger just by being here, let me comm-link..." "Who said I was staying?" Gamma was making his way back to the backstage entrance. He knew where he wanted to go, the Apocalypse be tossed in the Pit for all he cared. "What?" Tracking the larger mech's traverse up the stage's stairwell, Jazz tried to fathom the turmoil that Gamma was going through: not only losing friends, but also kin at the same time was something too much for the larger mech to handle, but what Jazz was offering the Neutral was safety within the Autobot faction under the leadership of Prime. "I need to go somewhere, anywhere away from here." "Then a friend or two and I will take you somewhere. You'll be safe." "I just want to be left alone for a while. Can't handle this..." Gamma quickly stormed out of the venue, Jazz following. No sooner did Gamma left through the ruined backstage door, did he transform into his vehicle mode and sped off into the array of access tunnels around the venue, leaving Jazz behind. The special-ops mech was about to engage in pursuit, when he received an urgent incoming comm from Iocon. Opening the link, the image of the new Prime occupied some of the real estate on Jazz's visor, which acted as a supplemental H.U.D. that the mech relied upon. Cutting to the chase, the Prime quickly got to the business at hand. The urgency in his voice was thick enough to cut with a plasma scalpel. "Jazz, any luck in your rendezvous with Epi, er, Epsilon?" "Sorry Prime. When I got here, it was already too late. Looks like somebody got here first and slaughtered everyone that was here... Epsilon included!" "No! Silentwing, Torquer, even Gamma..." "Not Gamma." "What?" "Gamma was with me on the access-way to Musidrome when it got bombed. We had a real fun time getting ourselves down." "Is he with you?" "'Fraid not, he must have went into emotional overload when he saw his twin off-line before his very optics. He hurried out of here, wanting to be alone." "Primus! He's in grave danger out there. If a Decepticon patrol sees him..." "He's probably in more danger than you think. I saw Epsilon hook a data cable to Gamma's interface before his spark extinguished: Gamma probably doesn't know about the files." It seemed like forever for Prime to get the full weight of what was just said, but it was just a couple of nano-kliks when Prime spoke. "Return to Iacon Jazz..." "What about Gamma, the files?" "I'll handle this one myself; I personally know a place or two where Gamma Antares might have gone to." "Is that advisable? Its not real receptive to any Prime right now out in the open." "I'll be fine, I know the neighborhood!" "If you insist. To let you know, there's another member who isn't accounted for." "Their newest member, they called him "T-A". I'll keep an optic out just in case. Prime: out." When Jazz's link to the Prime was disengaged, the special ops officer let out a small amount of air from his vents to indicate a sigh, transformed and went his way in a different direction from where Gamma left to. He said a silent prayer to Primus that this new Prime would have luck in finding the brown mech who he befriended, hopefully in functional condition. As he rolled away, he didn't notice the gunmetal grey and red form emerge into the light streaming into the backstage area from the shadows. This mech, even larger than Gamma and Jazz combined, had the foresight to keep his dampening field on when the two other mechs were around. When the the mech with crimson optics was sure he was alone, he opened his comm-link. "Tasker Alpha to Decepticon headquarters..." [Memory File:PDA00015:End Playback]

'Figures the Vha'scuht(translation: scumbag) would lead me here.' Gamma Antares said to himself as he entered the abandoned warehouse. The Autobot commando was chasing the Decepticon Mercedes limo through the streets of Tranquility after finding him near an internet cafe in alt-mode, doing data acquisition of some kind. Gamma had to cross reference the personnel files his late twin had gathered to find out that the energy signature matched what was left at the scene of a recently killed Autobot foot soldier. A few days had passed since the no-show, and it took a chance patrol to find what remained of Wrongway and relay his location to reach Prime and the others back at the base. At the cordoned-off area, Ratchet and the recently arrived Gamma examined the damage that the deceased received, with Gamma noting the same kind of injuries that some of his cohorts in the Rigel Rowdies unit had sustained. After startling the Decepticon from behind, Gamma had to give chase when the Mercedes limo noticed the first year Pontiac Grand Am charging at him and bolted from the scene. He messaged the Autobot base for back-up just to be on the careful side; he knew Lacerate was a bit psychotic, so any additional numbers would insure the possible capture of the rouge. After disappearing in the darkness of the warehouse, Lacerate was wondering who the Autobot that was chasing him was: that question was answered shortly after the hunter climbed up to the ceiling from what building support he did find. Gamma quickly emerged from his alt-mode, left arm converting to twin rail-gun mode. He did so while some street lighting outside the building backlit the brown Pontiac, revealing his caprine helm in silhouette. Only his amber optics could be clearly seen in the darkness. "So what are you supposed to be: an Ibex?" Lacerate's menacingly-laughter filled voice emerged from the inky blackness, deep within the warehouse. "Coming from you Lacerate," Gamma said while trying to triangulate on his quarry's position with his audios; the echos and reverberations making such difficult, while side-stepping into the darkness to better conceal his own position. "A tra's'loo (Trans: chump) like you shouldn't be speakin'!" Hearing a non-Terran word being used at first confused the Decepticon, who then had to go through all the language files he had about the planet's multitude of patterns of speech. Finding nil results, the hunter angrily retorted, "What did you call me, billy goat?!" Trying to ignore the insult, the Autobot got a better fix on the arachnid but needed to keep his opponent talking to get a more precise fix. "I'd have called you something worse, but there is no equivalent for "Afthole" that I know of." 'Liar!' Gamma thought to himself in amusement, '"fa'Veloht" is about as close as it can get.' This got Lacerate to growl briefly in anger, "Why don't you go chew on a tin can, goat-mobile!" Slightly irritated, but mindful of his goal, Gamma tilted one of his audios down to a horizonal position to scan for elevation. He knew of the error-filled misnomer about caprine types, the K'Veht-sav included, and found the term idiotic to say the least. He needed his target to say something fast, something he can use for final triangulation. "For a beat-up old mech like you Lacerate, I find that your database is just as corrupted as your spark!" The Autobot rebuked harshly. What came next was a string of Cybertronian expletives, followed by the light of an incoming missile from the Decepticon's position. Upon hearing the expletives, Gamma managed to fire-off a couple of mortar shells from his rail gun, and moved as quickly as he could to the right when the missile's exhaust was seen. He didn't move quickly enough, but managed to get out of the direct path of the explosive. One of Gamma's shells managed to hit the support beam underneath the Decepticon, severing it in two, but it was the sudden mass shift was that sent Lacerate to the ground when he lost his grip. When he landed, it was hard enough to momentarily off-line him for couple of seconds, as his pain sensors went white static overload throughout his entire structure. When he came to, Lacerate found that he was under the rubble of a partially collapsed roof. Crawling from the wreckage, the scuffed-up Decepticon made his way to where his opponent was, machine guns at the ready. 'Who in the Pit is this Autobot, and how does he know who I am?' Gamma was still online after the missile that was meant for him left a gapping hole in the wall where he was. If it wasn't for calculating quickly to get out of the way, he'd be Poncho parts all over the place. Even though he avoided most of the blast, his HUD indicated a small lubricant leak in his left ankle assembly after a chunk of cinder block impacted his pede. When he heard movement from Lacerate's position, he quickly got back on his pedes, ignoring the pain sensor from his ankle sub-assembly. He quickly reached back with his right hand to get his latest version of his multi-face, and grabbed the handle. While bringing it around, he gave it a mental command to go into shield mode. Its main body stayed in its Autobot sigil shape, while the handle extended itself, segmented and folded back to be at the ready: Gamma knew about Lacerate's machine gun placements, which the shield offers protection for, but not the Decepticon's missiles. Getting in a ready position to continue battle, The Autobot commando observed two sets of ruby optics coming towards him. He was a bit surprised that Lacerate didn't open fire when the Decepticon got closer, but instead started asking questions. "Who in the name of the Pit are you, Autobot?" Lacerate demanded, he wanted to know exactly the designation of that which chased him to the warehouse, and managed to locate his near-exact position to send him crashing to the ground. Was this an enemy specially built to out-hunt one of Megatron's most loyal of minions, or was this unknown construct someone who he doesn't recognize due to the vorns of warfare? He needed to know, even if he got off-lined for good as a reward. "I'm not about to end this until I find out." "You remember Isobar, Chuckbit, and Miros?" The brown Autobot asked in return. "Should I?" The Decepticon answered, taken aback by the unexpected question. He didn't know these unknown mechs his enemy had just brought up. "I was their second in command," Gamma angrily returned, raising his primary weapon towards the hunter. "... and close friend!" When he did, his unit cuneiform etching of the Rigel Rowdies on his left bicep armor caught what little light poured from the nearby impact hole in the structure. Gamma's mind briefly went to the three dead cohorts: the times they had cracking jokes on each other, especially the always wise-cracking Miros. Gamma then remembered the remains of his friends when he returned from an extended scouting mission: the armor ripped open to expose severed energon, coolant, and lubricant lines: devoid of the contents that were instead in pools around the victims. He was still haunted by his grisly discovery so many vorns ago; if he didn't go on that reconn mission at the last moment when he did, he'd be among the dead himself. Regaining his composure, he reactivated the force coils on his rail gun. The violet glow of the coils grew in intensity. "So it is my duty to either take you as a prisoner of war..." "I won't allow that to happen, Captain Antares!" Lacerate retorted, finally recognizing his opponent. He wasn't about to easily be captured by a lone Autobot bent on justice, or by any Autobot he'd just as well kill before that happened. Lacerate was about to let loose a round or two of one of his machine guns, when he noticed an approaching vehicle mode out of the corner of his optics. He hoped that this was the backup he requested himself while being pursued by the Cabrabot who is over twice his height in stature. "You see, I didn't get all the Rowdies when my own unit attacked: you're all that is left." "No huy'tock (trans: shit), dumbaft!" Gamma growled sarcastically, noticing the squad car as well but didn't give it any mind. It was sitting at the entrance to the warehouse, still in alt-mode waiting for its cue to act if needed. "I won't be as easy to take down." "We'll see." Lacerate proclaimed before lunging at the brown Grand Am. The Decepticon was suddenly flooded in the direct lighting from the squad car; headlights and spotlight going at full intensity to blind the optics of the arachinid-con in mid-attack. Lacerate suddenly felt himself slamming hard right into the hardened metallic surface of Gamma's shield, and then the sensation of suddenly being thrown backwards, slamming the concrete of the warehouse in a skidding, sparking stop. "Slag it Barricade! Why did you blind me?" Furious over the change of events, Lacerate practically screamed as he was getting up. By this time his outer structure showed more heavy denting and scratches: this Autobot is a tough one to deal with, a weakness must be found quickly. The answer that came back from the second form, now in bipedal mode wasn't that of Barricade at all, but from a blue-opticed Autobot. "If you couldn't tell, I'm not exactly one of your own cohorts, Lacerate!" "Prowl?! Slag no!" Raising his own weapon towards the Decepticon, the Autobot S-I-C plainly replied,"Yes without a doubt. If you two are done, there's important business to attend to." Exasperated, Lacerate's rage was getting the best of him, "What kind of business?" "None of yours, Lacerate. Ours." Energizing his main weapon, Prowl continued. "If you value what's left of your structure, leave!" "NO!" Suddenly, the Decepticon lunged at the Dodge Charger-based Highway Patrol car, claws ready to rip into the Autobot, when he felt caught by the throat by a large hand that then proceeded to bare-down hard; the pain his neck components were receiving was excruciating. When he focused on where the hand came from, he found it was his original opponent who got to him. Gamma had also changed his multi-face to axe mode, where the sigil shifted around to produce a double-edged, energy enhanced bladed weapon. The Cabrabot poised it to strike if needed. "Weren't you just told to leave, Decepticon?" Gamma angrily growled at his prisoner. "It wouldn't be good if you left in pieces!" "Enough you two!" Prowl demanded, showing some irritation through his ever present logical demeanor. "Gamm, release him." "But Prowl," The Cabrabot exclaimed, while trying to maintain grip on the struggling Decepticon. "He made a move towards you. You know what would have happened if I didn't act in time!" "That I know. But just the same, fun time is over." The Autobot sub-commander plainly said. After a few seconds of contemplation, the Autobot commando decided to comply, but needed his opponent's assurance that further attacks weren't going to happen. Looking at the Mercedes right in the optics, demanding an answer. "One wrong move and I'll cleave you, s'nt'az?(trans: understand?)" After getting the gist of the demand, Lacerate nodded slightly. He reasoned to himself that he was outnumbered as well as out gunned, another opportunity might come around to even the score when Primus will permit it. Suddenly he felt the Autobot's grip loosen from around his neck, but not totally free until he was placed back on the ground. Feeling for damage, Lacerate found no sustained structural or systems damage that time and self-repair wouldn't take care of. Angrily looking up at the Cabrabot, Lacerate was about to say something when his foe cut in. "Weren't you told to leave?" Nodding slightly, Lacerate slowly made his way to the blast hole. Stopping briefly, Lacerate turned slightly to the Autobots and defiantly snapped a couple digits of his right claw towards them. Enraged, Gamma raised his axe and made one step towards the defeated Decepticon. Prowl reached for the handle, and stopped any further carnage. Gamma gave his superior an incredulous look. "It is done, did you hear?" Prowl said, as the Decepticon scurried outside and painfully converted to vehicle mode. The remaining mechs heard the Decepticon leave in a hurried fashion, but said nothing until the Mercedes was well out of range. "Sub-commander?" A perplexed Cabrabot asked his superior, while storing his multi-face on his back. "Yes captain?" "Why did you have me release Lacerate? He'll only strike again." Prowl sighed to himself, does this have to be explained to every OC who makes planet-fall? "Gamma, do you have your contract with you?" "Um, sure." "Take it out, and go to paragraph 17, sub sections 21c~f." Gamma takes a stapled stack of paper out of a storage compartment of his right wrist armor, and pages through until he gets to the right spot. "Subbaduh, yubbaduh... all OC characters must abide to the yhudda, yuhudda... Oh!" When he finished reading the document, the Cabrabot's audios drooped all the way down. "There you go captain. Your OC contract with the fandom stipulates that you have to act in a manner consistent which doesn't contradict with that of the established behavior of canon characters." "Even catch and release?" "Yes." "Sahrg! (trans: FUCK!)" "Oh, and captain?" Downcast, the Pontiac raised his helm slightly to see his sub-commander. "Yes sir?" "Quit cursing in an alien language: your author has to make that slag up." "Sorry." "Don't worry about it too much. I do have some great news though." "Sir?" "After Ratchet fixes that leak of yours, We'll both be heading to the Reno area." "Why there?" "The Wreckers are about to make planet-fall: let's go greet them!" "You think they'll recognize me?" Gamma joked. After a brief glance at the Cabrabot, Prowl shook his head. "Captain, don't make me go into infinite loop!" Both Autobots went into their respective vehicle modes and left the warehouse, heading back to the Autobot base.

A human is seen sitting at a laptop in his mostly crowded room, surfing the Internet. The Author's room is partitioned roughly in half: towards the outside wall and running parallel is the twin bed. Across from the footboard sits a 21" CRT-based RCA TV/VCR combo. The VCR had long ago worn out its heads, and has been replaced by a unit that is tied-in with the stereo system further down the same wall. On either side of the TV, bookshelf speakers with 10" woofers sat upon what the owner had: for the left speaker was on its side on top of three wooden crates, each filled with vinyl records of LP size, while the right was on top of a shorter rack overflowing with DVDs. Though the speakers were on their sides, they were set in a way as to have the tweeters the furthest from each other. A smaller speaker for center-channel sound was perched on top of the TV, with two ball caps, one for the Cleveland Indians and one the city's NFL team, collecting dust on top of that. The other half of the bedroom, right next to the sliding doors of his closet, is dedicated to the Author's computer desk and music gear. A sixteen-space rack is off to his left, while a Deltex stand holding up a covered 61 key synth is angled in to denote the area further. While the Author was surfing, a brown figure materializes, human size, into the small area between the stereo and in front of the keyboard stand. When the figure sees what the Author is doing, he then proceeds to let out a metallic cough to let the human know that the Autobot plot bunny was in the room. "I thought that you were continuing to write my story? You haven't posted much of anything as of late..." The Author turned from what he was doing to look over his left shoulder to acknowledge the visitor. "Where the heck have you been, Gamma? Can't write much if you don't come around to yak about yourself, can I?" "I see you point, but I've been busy as of late." Turning away to look at his laptop screen, the human replied dryly. "What can you ever be busy with? Not much of anyone here knows you exist!" The image folded his arms across his chestplates, irritated with the comment. "To let you know, I have more of a social life than you ever will have, hermit!" "Do tell." The human sarcastically said while he looked out the corner of his left eye, shutting down his connection to the Web. He spun his chair to squarely face the virtual visitor. "In my case with this economy, and the fact that partying of any kind gives me migraine, I'm saving money!" "What happened to Lee's "Stone Bunnys" project? Didn't you have at least three songs to learn the bass parts to?" "Yeah I did..." "Did?! Why, what happened?" The brown Autobot plot bunny was aghast with the past-tense answer. "Dunno, we were supposed to meet up at L-5 a week after Doyle's funeral, but nobody was there. Never heard from Thompson after that. Kinda figured that they didn't need my services anymore." The Author then realized something about that time months ago that he didn't ask about the last time the OC last shown himself. "Hey!" "Yeah?" "Were you with us at the time, jamming on something with us? I swear that caught you in the back of my mind doing such. Did you..." "The answers are: Yup, and Pit yeah you did see me jamming with something. I already made a replacement with 'Jacks assistance. I'll tell you about it later." "Wheeljack?! How many explosions happened during that time?" "Only one, poor little Marshall stack..." The OC bowed his helm down in mock remorse. The mech almost gave himself away with a stifled giggle. "Had to have been one of Blackmore's old 200 watters then; bad, urm..., transformer." "Who, me or the amp?" Gamma pressed for an answer. "The amp. The power transformer. Couldn't handle the load after a while of his playing at full power." "Oh." Changing subject back to main path, the human had a few more questions. "Other than that, what have you been up to?" "Megatron and I went to the last Gladiators game in Atlanta. Got over-energized silly during the second half. We couldn't transform and Megs couldn't fly, we were that slag-faced. Nice to know that the House of D's leader is capable of showing his other side. Everyone thinks of him as some big silver meany or something. Everyone of Cybertronian origin knows better." "So," It was the human's turn to press for answers. "How did you two get back?" "Walked." "... O.o..." "Plot bunny land has quantum doorways: enter you destination, and go when cleared. Humans should invent it." "Oh. So, what was everyone's reaction when you two sauntered back?" "Prime: ready to give the both of us one of his speeches of profundity about responsible energon consumption..." "Sheesh, not even I would want to sit through one of those!" "No human known is capable of having the patience of sitting through one of those; I try to avoid it like a cosmic rust plague. When Megs' sister found out..." "Oh snap, Novatrann! What she do?" "She nearly went ballistic, saying things as 'being a poor example to her sparklings' and such. Something about being an uncle having to show certain traits for them to look up to and all." "As an uncle myself..." "Yes, you know what she means then." "Right, especially when I'm also a godfather to boot." "Precisely! Certain standards to uphold, even with that five year-old TF fan of a nephew of yours." Changing subject quickly, the human asked, "What else have you been doing, still snarking the NASCAR races and such?" "With Chuck and the others? Every race!" "I'll never know why a Monte Carlo based mech like Chuck would choose a human name." "Same reason why 'Ratchet' is 'Ratchet': named after a tool." "Oh. You guys still pulling that 'Unknown Comic' stunt on him: putting a brown paper bag over your head and going "Chuckie, Chuckie, Chuckie!" at him while doing pelvic assembly thrusts?" "Not as often." "Chuck anticipates it now?" "Too much, especially after Optimus pulled the stunt on him once." The image of Prime doing an 'Unknown Comic' bit was too much for the Author to handle. "Oh my, even Prime?!" "Why should you be surprised? You had wrote Optimus in a pink tu-tu earlier this year..."

Except for that brief incident between Gamma Antares, one of Optimus Prime's pre-war friends that is now heading a commando mission back to Cybertron, and Sunstreaker, one of the troops who was on the Ark with the Autobot high commander when it crash landed on Earth, the trip to Calico California was relatively uneventful. After getting used to his power output, Gamma started to analyze the vast desert that the convoy was traveling through. Stretches of arid lands, broken up with randomly placed sagebrush and other sparce plant life. He noted the similarity to the deserts of Gohn' Tacjh, remembering the days he spent away from the B'Suhl monastery just to speed along the lone, little used highways back on K'Veht. He'd go about as full speed as he could just to enjoy the thrill of speed for its own sake: after he and Epi were kicked-out of all racing, the opportunity to open his throttle wide was few and far between during Cybertron's "Golden Age". Gamma was still convinced to himself that the reason for the banishment was all a ruse to get the Antares brothers out of the way to make room for a newer generation of racer who'd not take "dangerous" chances, and see the race team leader's orders as final word and to not to be argued with. All that was nothing but moot point now, there was no time for such pastimes when survival was more important. Sure there were pockets of racing here and there, mostly among the lifeforms that the war hadn't touched yet, but actually participating in a race wasn't something Gamma really wanted to do anymore. Before the war, music had pretty much was a better replacement in terms of teamwork; especially where his admiration of Silent Wing was concerned. The war put all that off-kilter even in that department. Through the vorns and vorns the war had gone on, one was never sure that the unit that one was assigned to was the one that might have a chance to survive a while, especially the unit he was last assigned to, The Rigel Rowdies. That unit was mostly comprised of those who were discipline problems in other Autobot units, and transferred to one of the most desolate outposts the faction had. Almost everyone there was a problem dumped there for some reason or another, but Gamma was given transfer to be second-in-command over the Rowdies under a very unimpressive leadership of a mech called Omnibuss, who was seemingly more interested getting slagged on shots of Ultra with a High Grade wash, than being a leader of an Autobot unit. Fitting in at first was difficult, as the unit wasn't receptive to newcomers, made more difficult by the fact that real discipline within the ranks was close to nil unto itself; a determined mech like Gamma who had personal reasons to fight the Decepticons, was practically out of place being s-i-c to this bunch. That is, until he befriended a small circle of mechs who liked to do one thing whenever a broadcast of some obscure motor race was somehow picked-up on one of the frequencies that were scanned. While watching the race, they had a running commentary, often times hilarious, to break-up the monotony. When jokes weren't enough, Gamma would deploy his Multi-face into instrument mode to play a tune or two for the others enjoyment. This bunch called themselves the "Cracked Lugnuts". When Gamma was invited to join in, the rest found out his knowledge about the subject very useful as those who were originally of the group weren't racers before the war, but just fans who used the diversion to take their minds off the current situation. But a diversion only, as life was otherwise not the best for the Rowdies where they were stationed. What happened to the unit as a whole wasn't a very pleasant memory for Gamma. By having the luck of being assigned a deep recon/scouting mission due to the fact that the mech who was originally ordered to do so was in medbay for emergency repairs, Gamma was four orns into his mission when he received signal from the base that they were under heavy Decepticon attack. When Gamma managed to return, the presence of the Decepticon unit on base with little or no Autobot signal meant that Gamma was too late to be of any help. In order to avoid imminent detection, Gamma had to do something he'd hoped he never had to do: abandon his comrades to their fate, find another unit to both inform the Autobot leadership of the Rowdies demise and to rejoin the actual war effort. So started his lone quest. When his search for another Autobot unit in the vast galaxy proved to be fruitless, sometimes finding a vorns long abandoned base of operations of one faction or another, he decided to explore where he can. Refueling both himself and his transport wasn't a problem: he'd land on a planet where in some shape or another, raw material could be converted to energon with the help of a on-board distiller that someone had the foresight to design into the vehicle's systems. At times the process took a while, so Gamma took the opportunity to explore the planet to pass that time. At times he'd luck on landing on a planet where there was sentient life, sometimes to the point of achieving the point of technological advancement of having mechanized transportation. For these, he'd trans-scan one of the native machines to blend-in unnoticed during his explorations. In these societies, he'd scan the frequency bands primarily to get a lock on what language was being spoken. This is when he'd tune in an entertainment frequency to hear what the native music was like. What he heard amazed him. What he heard were not only variations of how an octave was sub-divided, he also heard timbers he never encountered before being used. Some of them were not even electronically generated. At this, his curiosity was piqued of such things as organic tonalities. When he heard the sound of plucked strings, he was pretty much locked into wanting to explore this means of sound production further. But that'll be something for him to work on later. Securing the K'Veht-sav data was more important now. He must not let that data be accessed in any shape or form by the Decepticons, up to and including willing to destroy his captured multi-face without transfer of a single byte to his internal storage: his former host world doesn't need Megatron or his not-so-merry band of minions to complicate matters while K'Veht and Z'Dian Central Government were in truce negotiations at that moment. When Gamma made an emergency landing on K'Veht 350 Earth-years ago, both factions were twenty years into a dispute over the resources of one of the moons of the inner gas giant Galhrawh in a nearby stellar system. Gamma had a little time after landing to assess the repairs he needed to do to his ship's main drive before planetary defenses, called Skywarn converged on his location. Thinking fast, Gamma converted to his alt-mode and stayed beside the ship in hopes that the local dominate lifeform wouldn't notice that he was the pilot, but just another mechanism in the area. The fact that both the ship and his alt-mode were of alien design didn't help much, as when a commando team was sent into the ship to investigate in what they thought was a Z'Di invasion, they found that the interior and accommodations were for somebody much larger than they were, or even of a Z'Dian, which induced more caution within ranks when they proceeded to investigate Gamma himself: who himself had an interior area more in line of the size of the lifeform the Skywarn ground unit members were comprised of. After arrangements were made for equipment to arrive to impound the vehicles for examination, none of the members of the commando unit even suspected the smaller alien vehicle had any sentience of any kind. That stayed that way until both Gamma and his shuttle were secured in a hanger that was integrated into a mountainside some considerable distance from the landing area. Gamma's initial stay in the hanger was that of boredom while under surveillance until those who were in charge of studying both machines decided to hook the both of them to diagnostic computers to analyze the systems of the alien machines, which at first was difficult as the interfaces that both Gamma and his ship had wasn't seen before by K'Veht scientists. After the scientists successfully found a way to connect systems together, they decided to test Gamma first, as he was the smaller machine and chosen as the first test subject. While the scientists were going over what readouts that Gamma was willing to let them have, he himself stealthily tracked back their own systems to try to find out where he was; finding language files to communicate with his captors didn't hurt either... "Bang!" Something nudged Gamma out of his thought thread. "Yo, Kwai-Chang!" It was the voice of Jazz, who was trying to get Gamma's attention for the last couple of kliks, after having dropped his position to the back of the convoy. Optimus tried to reach Gamma via the Autobot comm-link, but didn't get a response, so he requested Jazz to personally to check upon the brown Cabrabot. "Everything alright?" Continued the saboteur, "Looked like you were rollin' in your sleep." "I'm fine Jazz," Gamma reassured his soon to be mission partner, "This desert environment just reminded me of somewhere else, that's all." "Oh..." "What was Optimus' comm?" "That we are nearing the site of the current space bridge, with an included map of the area. Wan' me ta 'burst ya a copy?" "Sure!" After receiving the data, Gamma analyzed it for ideas of how to get to the bridge with the minimum of fuss or damage to the surrounding town. What he came up with might work, but he doesn't know if any of the Decepticons that were there would have had in mind what he planned, but it would have to do. "Jazz." "Yeah Gamms?" "We'd better get up front so I can tell Prime my plan. Some of it will be improvised though." "Good thing I'm commin' 'long then, when it comes ta improvisin'..." "I couldn't ask for anybody better than you Jazz, because there isn't!" "You're being too kind, Gee. We better head up front." As soon as Gamma had vocalized "Sure", both the Porshe and the Pontiac made their way to the front of the convoy via the high speed berm.

[Memory File:PDA00014:Accessed:Begin Playback] It took both cars about several breems to finally get to Musidrome. A couple of Jazz' shortcuts didn't pan out, as wreckage impeded progress to the point where both mechs had to revert to robot form just to clear enough of it out of the way to continue forward. When they reached the backstage entrance, both noticed the large doors were ripped off, as if somebody much larger wanted to get in quickly and saw the double pocket doors as a momentary inconvenience to deal with. "This isn't looking good, Jazz. Now I know something is dreadfully wrong." "Really?" Jazz cracked, but Gamma only shot him a look of disapproval. "Not now Jazz, not if I don't know if the others are alright." "Sorry" The smaller mech contritely said as he approached one of the dislocated doors. "No blast residue. Definitely someone wanted to get in, not out." Examining the other door, Gamma's own knowledge about violent chemical reactions only confirmed what Jazz just told him, until he noticed the large indentations of where the intruder gripped the edge of the door to rip it out. "Whoever it was, must be pretty big to do this," Gamma added. "Don't like the looks of this. We better see if everything is O.K." When they entered, they turned left to a short corridor that led to the backstage proper. The silence was disconcerting; instead of the usual noises of a musical group getting ready for a performance, like sound system checks and fragments of songs being played nervously. Even the lack of laughter of Torquer the time keeper was missing. "Too quiet around here Jazz, hope nothing happened." "Doesn't sound like anybody is here" "There has to be, I see the stage is still lit..." Gamma and Jazz noticed the band equipment in disarray when came upon the backstage-left area, sound reinforcement modules either knocked over or destroyed outright. External musical instruments that were to be neatly arranged for performance were as well broken or thrown about violently. "Primus, what the pit happened?" Jazz was shocked at the turmoil before him onstage. 'Who ever did this had to be the same one who ripped the doors off' He reasoned to himself. "Where's the others?" The destruction had Gamma in a panic, concern of the well being of the others upmost on his main processor. "Epi? 'Wing? Torque? You guys here? T-A?" "Who's T-A, Gamma?" "Tasker-Alpha is our latest member Jazz, kinda moody at times. I just hope none of them were here when this happened." "I just hope it wasn't 'cause of who ripped the backstage doors open Gee, I don't wanna..." "PRIMUS, NO!" Gamma exclaimed in horror when he found a form lying still on the stage floor, behind what was left of some of the larger components of the group's equipment. "What's the matter?" "Silent-Wing." Gamma said while hurriedly removing broken gear away from whom he discovered. "She's been shot!" When he got the area cleared out, Gamma noticed the gapping wound in the singer's chest plate where her spark chamber was located. It was gone. Blasted into nothing, leaving a hole that went through her upper torso sub-structure. Silent-Wing died instantly with that one shot. When Jazz rushed over to Gamma and his grisly discovery, he inadvertently tripped over a piece of broken band gear, causing the white and blue mech to land on the stage decking almost face plate first. By quickly putting his arms out to catch his fall, Jazz ended up looking that he was about to do push-ups. "That was too close for..." He stopped what he was about to say mid sentence when a reflection, caught his attention from the outer corner of his right optic. "GAMMA!" The larger brown mech wasn't paying attention to what just happened to Jazz; the sight of the femme and how he felt for her was pre-occupying him when Jazz called-out. When Jazz got up from his near prone position, he noticed that his new friend was holding the deceased femme gently in his arms in a tender embrace. "Gamma?" "Who could have did this to you, 'Wings?" Gamma gently whispered to the dead femme, hoping somehow that she would answer. "Gamma, I don't believe she'll be able to answer that." Jazz tried to console the brown mech,noting the tender scene unfolding before his optics. "She's too far gone." Gamma looked up to Jazz, processing for a moment. "Yeah, I know. But she wasn't the type to harm even a nanite." After gently putting the deceased femme back down, the brown musically inclined mech got up to face his travel companion. "You find something?" "Saw something when I tripped. I think its mech fluid." "Where?" "Upstage, near the percussion platform." "Slag, Torquer!" Gamma hurriedly went to the percussion platform, itself a site of localized chaos. He found the much larger mech behind the platform, sprawled under the stage's built-in backdrop. The huge panel not only supplied back lighting for the stage, but also did so in a way that would have been tied-in to what music was being played in real time. The panel has somehow had dislodged from its mountings and was bearing full weight on the slowly discoloring form underneath. "Jazz, I could use assistance in getting this off." Gamma tried to lift the stage right vertical edge of the panel, finding it a bit heavy even for himself to lift alone. "Sure, where do ya want me to lift?" Jazz asked as approached the backdrop panel. "My side, so I can get this off Torque." When both mech lifted the panel, still a task unto itself even when both were jostling it, the red and black mech underneath was found without helm: but not decapitated by the panel, but with tell-tale signs that it was blasted off. The discovery horrified both Jazz and Gamma to silence for a few klicks until Jazz found courage to speak up. "Who'd the Pit would do that? Looks like this guy never had a chance!" "I don't know," Gamma said with growing despondence, "Torque was always known for making friends easily. Wicked sense of humor." "I would've liked him Gamma, but it looks like not much else to do here..." Jazz was about to continue what he was about to say, including suggesting going to Iacon to report this situation and to arrange the proper treatment of the lifeless forms, when both mechs heard a noise from in front of the stage, down on the audience floor. The low metallic moaning of "Gahmm!" was unmistakable to Gamma. The brown mech approached the edge of the stage to peer down. In front of the stage it was barely lit to see the seats below, but the shadow that was cast directly in front hid a sprawled-out form from Gamma's optics until they re-calibrated to let in more light. Gamma was horrified by what he saw. "EPSILON!" [Memory File:PDA00014:End Playback]
