__The ancient, by human standards, town of Calico used to be a moderately successful silver mining/borax outpost during the region's "Wild West" days. Nestled in the foothills near Yermo California, the town would have been another relic, slowly decaying in the California desert sun had it been not for the Knott's corporation seeing the interest in having such a place for tourists who were into all things of that time-frame in American history. The town has been partially restored, in spite of a couple of fires that threatened to do away with the little town altogether, so that tourists who braved the desert trek, can do such things as wander around, learn how the residents of the 1880s lived, and maybe get caught in the "crossfire" of a staged shoot-out. On the hour, every hour. __Today wouldn't have been different, but the town with its name spelled out on the highest peak to the north had no visitors that day, visitors that were human and spent money at the print shop that was next to the tram tracks that brought tourists from the lower parking area, or even at Lil's Saloon where the hourly shoot-outs happened. There were none. But visitors of a different kind were there instead: they who didn't spend money on anything, but took without asking, and didn't care if anyone or anything was destroyed in the process. Today they were not taking, but sending. They had setup a 60 foot ring on the grounds in front of Hank's Hotel after easily chasing both visitor and employee away from the town. Soundwave, the Decepticon's intelligence/communications officer wouldn't mind taking the time to cause a little mayhem upon those who fled, but had to stick with the task of sending badly needed energon cubes back to Shockwave and the others back on Cybertron. The ring that was the space bridge portal was near completion with the cubes stacked, awaiting transport, but three of Soundwave's cassetticons were nowhere to be seen, having wandered off somewhere after completing the task of chasing off the humans themselves. __From behind the old schoolhouse, to corporeal eyes that can only see a column of desert dust whip up, actually appeared a 5' 10" figure of humanoid shape and dressed as to fit-in with the climate and location of his current destination: tan chinos, black boots with a buckle to adjust snugness around the ankle area. He wore a button-down shirt, but had it partially open to reveal a black crew shirt underneath. He was roughly Anglo-Saxon in appearance, with a thick shock of wavy brown hair that was being contained at the moment by a Stetson. He was a field operative for the Alpha Dimension: a place in space/time that many sentients have pondered the existence of over the too many centuries, and hotly denied by those who were "blinkered" by the unyielding precepts of corporeal science and reason. He gently fingered a horizontally elongated four-pointed star that was on his chest, and started to speak. "Alpha Operative Alexander reporting in: I'm at second assigned location after my stay at Autobot headquarters, and have Decepticons within sights. Appears to be Soundwave and Thundercracker, with no other at this moment. Advise?" His answer came fast and clear, seemingly if the other end of communication was nearby. "A-O Alexander, affirmative: do nothing until Autobot faction is in area. Be advised that Autobots are to gain access to the space bridge for data recovery ops. Assist without disclosure, the K'Veht-sav data must not be discovered by the Decepticons: A-O Jacob had a difficult, but successful time keeping Shockwave from deleting the data." "Acknowledged, central. Jacob probably was typing at lightning speed with all four hands just to keep up with Shockwave's one. Too bad I couldn't be there to add an extra pair." "Be advised as well, Alexander: Autobot called "Tracks" is close to discovery of of your presence at Autobot base during "Gamma Antares" repairs." "Want me to go back to suppress efforts after this is done?" "Negative, A-O Alexander: Omniarchy orders no such action be taken. Let them compute upon what is found for a while." "No problem with me then. Alexander: out." With that, Alexander stroked his badge to disengage his comm-link, and started to stroll towards Hank's Hotel, keeping an eye towards the south to the distant access road that was the only means of the Autobot convoy to get to Calico. "They'd better hurry, it looks like after Soundwave tracks down Rumble, Frenzy and Ravage, the Decepticons will be ready to send cargo." Within a moment, both Alexander's and Soundwave's question of the whereabouts of least two of the mini-cons were answered, as Frenzy walked onto the main, paved street of Calico from between the candle shop and Lil's Saloon, with Rumble entering the avenue just south of the Calico House Restaurant, facing each other with determination on both their faceplates. __"I've been waiting for this a long time, Dead-Optic Rumble. You ready?" "Yeah, Frenzy the Spazz..." "Don't call me that, slag eater!" "It fits, you over-energized bit bucket!" "Shut up and draw, glitch-headed moron!" "Go interface with a cop car!" __At that, both Decepticons drew their smaller, secondary weapons and fired. Both shots missed, one blast hitting a foot to Rumble's right, while the shot meant for Frenzy impacted just in front of his left pede. A-O Alexander chuckled to himself, shaking his head in mock disbelief. 'Two truisms in existence: Day destroys the night, and the lousy aim of Decepticons!' "Quit messing around ." Soundwave ordered the two mocking duelists, "Find Ravage," then his vocalizer harmony lowered a minor third for emphasis, "NOW!" Frenzy turned to face his superior after he saw Rumble lower his weapon, "Sure thing, you want us to split up to find Ravage quicker?" "Do it!" After finishing with the re-connections in the segment, Soundwave inadvertently walked in the path of A-O Alexander, which gave the trans-dimensional operative reason to pause after sensing the darkness of the blue mech's spark, but Soundwave gave no notice himself. Even though Tele-Tran was heavily damaged in the crash, it was intact enough to start repairs when a burst of geo-thermal energy was enough to reactivate the then dormant computer system. Mistaking the native Terran machinery as the dominate life form, Tele-Tran would then repair and reactivate all aboard based on what information gleaned of the data the probes found, and the capabilities and size of the individual robot to be revived based on the closest Earth approximation. But that was Earth years ago, and before the most recent Decepticon attack rendering Tele-Tran unable to remain the central data point the Autobot faction relied upon to keep tabs of events, both of the enemy as well as the actions of the indigenous occupants of the host planet they are currently on. "Come on, fit in already!" There had to be that one antenna placement that has to be the most difficult to deal with, even by robotic standards. It's mounting flange wasn't fabricated correctly, resulting in the bolts not going through one of the holes: the bolts diameter was slightly too big. "I'm going to have to find out who fabricated this flange, and remind them to follow the plans exactly!" Wheeljack's thread of thought was interrupted by the sound of an approaching car on the only access road to the base's sensor platform. "An early to mid 1970's A-body Pontiac by the look and sound of it," Wheeljack quickly concluded after consulting his internal database of every Terran road machine ever made, "but it doesn't look exactly like a Le Mans or even a GTO, not even close. I wonder if they need directions, must be lost if they ended up here." At that moment, Wheeljack's link to the base below came online. "Wheeljack, I've sent Gamma Antares to assist you on your activities up there." 'Gamma? So that's who this guy is.' was the first mental reaction Wheeljack had about the news, his own run-ins with the Autobot were few, but enough to let him know that at times Gamma can be quite the character; situation permitting. "Is that why there was a transport shuttle from Cybertron earlier, Prime?" "Yes," was Prime's response, "he was ambushed while on way to rendezvous with Elita-One and the others in our underground ops back on Cybertron. He was too badly damaged to be repaired there, so he was emergency transported here. He was changed a bit in the process." "As I can see, he's taken on a vehicle mode type I don't recognize as of yet. Mind if I interrogate him a bit?" "Just don't get too extreme!" Cautioned Prime. "Alright, but I'll keep the comm-link open on this end." "And I'll gather everyone around Tele-Tran!" <lj-cut text="Oh look, something is blinking!">	Task'r-Seven really didn't like taking orders from anyone, especially from that sycophant Megatron put in charge of operations on Cybertron, Shockwave. In fact, Task'r didn't like Megatron at all either, from the few times he's dealt with the Decepticon leader personally: he's seen close allies as well as production mates get blasted to slag whenever the leader's temper levels goes violent, and needs to vent on the nearest  and most unsuspecting target available. How he managed to stay out of range of that particle accelerator's business end was something he didn't care to calculate, he just considered himself fortunate that he never did find out. 
	
The Decepticon medium-altitude security hover was doing a very routine security sweep near an old Autobot fortification, making note if any in his opinion, foolish members of Autobot underground resistance that might make an appearance. He heard that there was an ambush earlier in his scan area, where an older Autobot was badly damaged in the attack and ensuing battle. He wasn't in the area at the time to be a participant: a constant source of frustration to him. "How come I always seem to miss all the fun," he calculated to himself, "it would be more enjoyable than this drudgery." At that moment his visual sensor arrays detected a faint, yet discernible tracking beacon flashing on the ground below, there weren't any tall structure that needed such warning lights to indicate that a structure was in the way, especially at ground level.
 	
Cautiously, he lowered himself to an altitude over the source of the mysterious light to get better scan of what is attracting his attention, and determine if it is worth reporting back to Decepticon HQ about. When his altitude got to about 12 meters by Earth measurement, Task'r's optical scanners with help of his searchlight, were able to make out a battle axe shape, among the debris of the recent battle ground. "Interesting, but why would an axe need a flashing beacon?" His scan then detected what he also suspected: an Autobot logo on the very end of the handle. "Autobot, alright! Any wonder those fools need flashing lights on their weapons, they always lose track of them."
